definitions.definition: The act or result of rolling, or state of being rolled.
definitions.example: Look at the roll of the waves.

definitions.definition: A forward or backward roll in gymnastics; going head over heels. A tumble.
Something which rolls.
A swagger or rolling gait.
A heavy, reverberatory sound.
definitions.example: Hear the roll of cannon.

definitions.definition: The uniform beating of a drum with strokes so rapid as scarcely to be distinguished by the ear.

The oscillating movement of a nautical vessel as it rotates from side to side, on its fore-and-aft axis, causing its sides to go up and down, as distinguished from the alternate rise and fall of bow and stern called pitching; or the equivalent in an aircraft.
The measure or extent to which a vessel rotates from side to side, on its fore-and-aft axis.
The rotation angle about the longitudinal axis.
definitions.example: Calculate the roll of that aircraft.

definitions.definition: The act of, or total resulting from, rolling one or more dice.
definitions.example: Make your roll.

definitions.definition: A winning streak of continuing luck, especially at gambling (and especially in the phrase on a roll).
definitions.example: He is on a roll tonight.

definitions.definition: A training match for a fighting dog.
(paddlesport) An instance of the act of righting a canoe or kayak which has capsized, without exiting the watercraft, or being assisted.
definitions.example: That was a good roll.

definitions.definition: (paddlesport) The skill of righting a canoe or kayak which has capsized.
definitions.example: She has a bombproof roll.

definitions.definition: To cause to revolve by turning over and over; to move by turning on an axis; to impel forward by causing to turn over and over on a supporting surface.
definitions.example: To roll a wheel, a ball, or a barrel.

definitions.definition: To turn over and over.
definitions.example: The child will roll on the floor.

definitions.definition: To tumble in gymnastics; to do a somersault.
To wrap (something) round on itself; to form into a spherical or cylindrical body by causing to turn over and over.
definitions.example: To roll a sheet of paper; to roll clay or putty into a ball.

definitions.definition: To bind or involve by winding, as in a bandage; to enwrap; often with up.
definitions.example: To roll up the map for shipping.

definitions.definition: To be wound or formed into a cylinder or ball.
definitions.example: The cloth rolls unevenly; the snow rolls well.

definitions.definition: To drive or impel forward with an easy motion, as of rolling.
definitions.example: This river will roll its waters to the ocean.

definitions.definition: To utter copiously, especially with sounding words; to utter with a deep sound; — often with forth, or out.
definitions.example: To roll forth someone's praises; to roll out sentences.

definitions.definition: To press or level with a roller; to spread or form with a roll, roller, or rollers.
definitions.example: to roll a field;  to roll paste;  to roll steel rails.

definitions.definition: To spread itself under a roller or rolling-pin.
definitions.example: The pastry rolls well.

definitions.definition: To move, or cause to be moved, upon, or by means of, rollers or small wheels.
To leave or begin a journey.
definitions.example: I want to get there early; let's roll.

definitions.definition: To compete, especially with vigor.
definitions.example: OK guys, we're only down by two points. Let's roll!

definitions.definition: To beat with rapid, continuous strokes, as a drum; to sound a roll upon.

To apply (one line or surface) to another without slipping; to bring all the parts of (one line or surface) into successive contact with another, in such a manner that at every instant the parts that have been in contact are equal.
To turn over in one's mind; to revolve.
To behave in a certain way; to adopt a general disposition toward a situation.
definitions.example: I was going to kick his ass, but he wasn't worth getting all worked up over; I don't roll like that.

definitions.definition: To throw dice.
To roll dice such that they form a given pattern or total.
definitions.example: If you roll doubles, you get an extra turn.

definitions.definition: To create a new character in a role-playing game, especially by using dice to determine properties.
definitions.example: I'm gonna go and roll a new shaman tonight.

definitions.definition: To generate a random number.
(of a vessel) To rotate on its fore-and-aft axis, causing its sides to go up and down. Compare with pitch.
(in folk songs) To travel by sailing.
To beat up; to attack and cause physical damage to.
To cause to betray secrets or to testify for the prosecution.
definitions.example: The feds rolled him by giving him a free pass for most of what he'd done.

definitions.definition: To betray secrets.
definitions.example: He rolled on those guys after being in jail two days.

definitions.definition: To be under the influence of MDMA (a psychedelic stimulant, also known as ecstasy).
(of a camera) To (cause to) film.
definitions.example: It's time to roll the cameras.

definitions.definition: To slip past (a defender) with the ball.
To have a rolling aspect.
definitions.example: the hills rolled on

definitions.definition: To perform a periodical revolution; to move onward as with a revolution.
definitions.example: The years roll on.

definitions.definition: To move, like waves or billows, with alternate swell and depression.
To move and cause an effect on someone
To make a loud or heavy rumbling noise.
definitions.example: The thunder rolled and the lightning flashed.

definitions.definition: To utter with an alveolar trill.
definitions.example: Many languages roll their r's.

definitions.definition: To enrobe in toilet-paper (as a prank or spectacle).
definitions.example: The kids rolled the principal's house and yard.

definitions.definition: To create a customized version of.
To engage in sparring in the context of jujitsu or other grappling disciplines.
That which is rolled up.
definitions.example: a roll of fat, of wool, paper, cloth, etc.

definitions.definition: A document written on a piece of parchment, paper, or other materials which may be rolled up; a scroll.
An official or public document; a register; a record
A catalogue or list
A quantity of cloth wound into a cylindrical form.
definitions.example: a roll of carpeting; a roll of ribbon

definitions.definition: A cylindrical twist of tobacco.
A kind of shortened raised biscuit or bread, often rolled or doubled upon itself; see also bread roll.
Part; office; duty; rôle.
A measure of parchments, containing five dozen.
(paddlesport) An instance of the act of righting a canoe or kayak which has capsized, without exiting the watercraft, or being assisted.
definitions.example: That was a good roll.
